page.title: 15JACOBEAN HOTEL
page.content: In the west of this area there is a country road running north-south. At the extreme south- west corner of the area there are crossroads. A small wooded area of conifers and deciduous trees is to be found in the extreme south of the area. The land is flat and low-lying. Fields are bordered by well established hawthorn hedges. There is an hotel, now called The Jacobean, but previously known as The Plainville Hotel, in the northwest of the area. The hotel is surrounded by deciduous trees and has a large well-kept garden to the rear. The farm, Plainville Farm, is situated next door and is mainly arable.
